comment: The solution is excellent and demonstrates a full understanding of the problem. It correctly derives the relation yx = x⁻¹y, uses it to establish an upper bound |G| ≤ 2n, and then correctly uses the dihedral group D₂n and von Dyck's theorem to establish the lower bound |G| ≥ 2n. The order is thus correctly determined to be 2n. The proof of the non-abelian property for n ≥ 3 is also correct and well-argued. The solution is clear, logical, and complete.
